alert.note: Alert for Coke; Sterling; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 11:54PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Coke, east central Sterling and northwestern Tom Green Counties through 1245 AM CDT... At 1154 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Broome, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Broome and Us-87 Near The Coke-Tom Green County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for west central Texas.
